lst.name: sentence
lst.str: Next year is likely to see a shortfall in zinc concentrates of up to 100,000 tonnes, although there should be ample supply in 1987, Shearson Lehman Brothers Ltd metals analyst Stephen Briggs said.

lst.name: sentence
lst.str: Speaking on the second day of Metal Bulletin's base metals conference, Briggs said the major factor in his predicted 100,000 tonne shortfall in zinc concentrate supply in 1988 was the imminent cessation of new mining and termination of milling at Pine Point in Canada.

lst.name: sentence
lst.str: This would partly be due to a return to more normal levels at existing mines in Australia and Peru, allied with achievement of full capacity of 170,000 tonnes a year at Faro in Canada.

lst.name: sentence
lst.str: This would partly be due to a return to more normal levels at existing mines in Australia and Peru, allied with achievement of full capacity of 170,000 tonnes a year at Faro in Canada.
